2. Abstract  
a. Project Motivation  
The current Jitsi whiteboard integration is built on a fork of Excalidraw, which means that while 
it provides a basic platform for collaboration, its functionality is quite limited. I see this as an 
opportunity to improve a core feature of Jitsi. The existing setup struggles with memory 
limitations and lacks some modern capabilities that could significantly enrich the collaborative 
experience. 
 
b. Key Enhancement 
This project proposes several important updates to elevate the whiteboard's usability. First, by 
enabling file upload support, users will be able to share documents and images directly on the 
whiteboard, adding a new layer of interactivity. Upgrading to Socket.IO 4 is another critical 
enhancement that will improve performance and ensure better compatibility with modern web 
standards. Additionally, migrating to a newer version of Excalidraw will bring advanced features

enhancement that will improve performance and ensure better compatibility with modern web 
standards. Additionally, migrating to a newer version of Excalidraw will bring advanced features 
and enhanced stability. Finally, optimizing WebSocket connections will help manage packet 
size and reduce latency, ensuring smoother real-time collaboration. 
c. Expected Impact   
Implementing these enhancements is expected to transform the whiteboard into a more robust 
and dynamic tool within the Jitsi ecosystem. The ability to upload files and share diverse 
content will encourage richer interactions among users. The technology upgrades—Socket.IO 
4, the latest Excalidraw, and improved WebSocket connections—will collectively boost 
performance, reduce delays, and create a more seamless user experience.  
Ultimately, these improvements will not only make the whiteboard more effective for 
collaboration but also contribute to making Jitsi a more competitive platform for online 
communication.

3. Project Overview  
3.1 Background & Motivation  
The current whiteboard integration in Jitsi is based on a fork of Excalidraw, which means it only 
allows for limited smart object sharing and enforces a strict memory overload limit. This setup 
works for basic tasks, but as more users try to collaborate, these limitations become a real 
bottleneck. It restricts the natural flow of creativity and can cause performance issues during 
intense collaborative sessions.

Enhancing the whiteboard is crucial for providing a richer and more versatile collaborative 
environment. By addressing the existing limitations, this project aims to improve the overall 
functionality and performance of the whiteboard tool. This upgrade will not only make it easier 
for users to share ideas and work together, but it will also help Jitsi stand out as a more robust 
platform for digital collaboration. 
3.2 Objectives  
This proposal outlines several clear and measurable objectives to significantly enhance the 
whiteboard experience. One of the primary goals is to implement file upload support. This 
feature will allow users to upload and share files directly on the whiteboard, adding an extra 
dimension to the collaborative process and making it easier to exchange detailed information. 
Another important objective is to upgrade to Socket.IO 4. By doing so, the project aims to boost

dimension to the collaborative process and making it easier to exchange detailed information. 
Another important objective is to upgrade to Socket.IO 4. By doing so, the project aims to boost 
the real-time communication performance and ensure better compatibility with modern web 
standards. Additionally, migrating to a newer version of Excalidraw will introduce improved 
features and stability, providing users with a more reliable and feature-rich drawing tool. 
Finally, optimizing WebSocket connections is key to ensuring smoother collaboration. By 
refining how packet sizes are managed, the project will reduce latency and enhance the overall 
responsiveness of the whiteboard during real-time interactions. Collectively, these objectives 
are designed to transform the whiteboard into a more powerful and user-friendly tool within the 
Jitsi ecosystem.

4. Technical Approach 
4.1 Proposed Solution and Architecture 
My approach focuses on enhancing the existing whiteboard by integrating additional file 
management features, updating the real-time communication layer, and migrating to an 
improved drawing engine. The solution involves adding file upload support so that users can 
easily share documents and images directly on the whiteboard. In addition, updating to 
Socket.IO 4 will improve the real-time performance and compatibility of the system, while 
optimizing WebSocket connections will ensure smoother communication during collaborative 
sessions.

The project will be broken down into several clear phases to ensure an organized and efficient 
approach  
● Phase 1 – Research and Planning:

● Phase 2 – Development

The project is estimated to require around 175 hours of work over a 12-week period.

deliverables will include an enhanced whiteboard source code with detailed inline

3. Project Overview  
3.1 Background & Motivation  
The current whiteboard integration in Jitsi is based on a fork of Excalidraw, which means it only 
allows for limited smart object sharing and enforces a strict memory overload limit. This setup 
works for basic tasks, but as more users try to collaborate, these limitations become a real 
bottleneck. It restricts the natural flow of creativity and can cause performance issues during 
intense collaborative sessions.

Enhancing the whiteboard is crucial for providing a richer and more versatile collaborative 
environment. By addressing the existing limitations, this project aims to improve the overall 
functionality and performance of the whiteboard tool. This upgrade will not only make it easier 
for users to share ideas and work together, but it will also help Jitsi stand out as a more robust 
platform for digital collaboration.

whiteboard experience. One of the primary goals is to implement file upload support. This 
feature will allow users to upload and share files directly on the whiteboard, adding an extra
